fields.question: How do I know if I am allergic to my medication?
fields.answer: The most common symptoms of drug allergy are hives, rash or fever. But a drug allergy also may cause serious reactions. This includes a severe, life-threatening condition known as anaphylaxis. Please see your GP or call 111 if you have these symptoms and they're not improving

fields.question: How long do I need to take my medication?
fields.answer: Please follow your Doctors advice on the length of time you should continue to take your medication. It is also useful to talk to a pharmacist to get some more details on the medications you are on.

fields.question: What if I have other medical conditions?
fields.answer: This website tells you the known common interactions, if your other medication is not here then it is seen to be safe. If you are in doubt or worried about the physical effects from a medical condition, please get in contact with your GP or call 111.

fields.question: What if we see something here which we think is not correct?
fields.answer: If you think some of our data is wrong, please send us a request to change in. To do this, log out and in the side navbar there will be a clickable link to send us a request. All you need is to know the name of the medication and we can do the rest!

fields.question: What if we have medications we would like to add?
fields.answer: If you want to add medications, you will have to be logged in. So make sure you're registered first and then click the 'contribute to our database' button. Then choose if you wish to add a brand or product and follow the forms instructions! Thank you for contributing.
